Reviews.Title: “More a 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elachristina
Reviews.Content: The location is great, right in the city center, between the the Plaza Espania and Santa Domingo Metro stations. Our room faced the inside of the building, was small, but clean. The a/c made a noise and we could not sleep until we turned off it. Internet connection only in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Short break in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: paperondepaperoni
Reviews.Content: The standards of comfort in this hotel are reflected in the price. The air conditioning in the room that was first allocated to us was very inefficient but the staff were happy to change us to another room with working aircon (the next day, because the hotel was full). Breakfasts were very good; rooms were clean and comfortable. Plumbing seemed fairly antiquated making it slow to run water in sink after flushing lavatory! But apart from these minor criticisms, for the price, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great wee hotel”
Reviews.Author: patter767
Reviews.Content: really enjoyed our stay, fantastic location and the staff were very helpful. Easy walking distance to many of the popular attractions of Madrid and with a metro on the doorstep you can get anywhere. only disapointment was that none of the double rooms appeared to have a balcony which was a bit of a dissapointment but otherwise great staff and nice neighbourhood for bars to people watch

Reviews.Title: “Good affordable hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Alistair M
Reviews.Content: A really decent hotel in a great location in Madrid. The hotel is right between the the Plaza Espania and Santa Domingo Metro stations. It does seem to be catered more towards business stays, but was perfectly decent as a base to explore Madrid. There are a couple downsides to the hotel: If your room faces the street, then it will be rather loud in the mornings and evenings if you are trying to sleep. There are some cleaning issues with the bathroom, there seems to be a moldy substance in the bathrooms and you will have to get used to the constant air freshner smell that is rather overpowring at times. On the plus side, the air-con works wonderfully and the breakfasts are really good value at EUR8 per person, with a really good spread of meats and cheeses.

Reviews.Title: “OK but avoid facing street!”
Reviews.Author: KermitTheTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our baby daughter for 7 nights. Overall the hotel is OK. Location excellent although street itself not particularly nice. Definitely not 4 stars - more like 3 stars. The breakfast was very good (orange juice amazing!). The rooms have been to a good standard but mainly no longer are - floors are worn out, furniture need replacing etc. Some rooms are in significantly better condition (and are bigger) than others. However - they key to a good stay at the hotel is to avoid the street! Most rooms are facing the street which gets very noisy at night partly due to the police station next door. While the noise is manageable with ear plugs and closing the shutters at night, you will be at the mercy of the A/C. Should you need to sleep with the window open, managing any sleep will be a great achievement. If you manage to get a better room facing the inner court, you will get good value for money - otherwise you will run the risk of a big disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ericg68
Reviews.Content: I arrived here late one night after a long trip from the US. The hotel is easily accessed by the metro, the front desk staff is very helpful, and the rooms are better than expected. This is a hotel I will recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and well located but not 4-star material”
Reviews.Author: jekko12
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in Madrid, primarily due to it's convenient location and unbeatable price. I could not have asked for a better location for the price. For under $100 a night, you do not get much better in a city like Madrid. Located just a minute walk from Santo Domingo, and a 10minute walk from Puerta Sol and the Royal Palace, you are never far from the sights. I agree with some of the other reviewers that the street may not look safe at first glance but there is a police station 2 buildings away from the hotel. I felt safe even at night. The property smells like air freshener the moment you walk in and the smell is stronger in the lobby area. The wifi is free in the rooms and the signal is great but the connection speed is slow. We got by and honestly you just need enough to look up a few restaurants here and there for your stay anyway. We had plenty of space in our inner-facing room on the 5th floor and the rooms were clean. I just had two complaints about the rooms: the bedding, and the heat. The bed is hard but what makes it worse is the coarseness of the sheets. I got rashes on my elbows from lying on the bed and watching TV. The room also has no heat control which makes it a bit unbearable on the hotter afternoons. We kept the windows open the whole time but it still felt uncomfortably hot at times. The hotel is pleasant and the staff are helpful but I definitely would not say it is a 4-star hotel, even in Europe. If you value location and price, this hotel is good for you, but if you want a little bit more comfort, I would look around some more as the rooms don't provide a great night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great Service, very suitable for business people”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location is great, right in the city center. The service was very good, helpful and kind. Nice breakfast. Big rooms. Very good for business travelers, couples on a romantic vacation may want to look for a better designed hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Coloso value for money”
Reviews.Author: Ormstein
Reviews.Content: I needed a hotel for a two night solo stay in Madrid as I was attending a concert on Saturday night. I knew from previously visiting lovely Madrid that a central location is very important for a hotel, because distances can be huge there. It is a vast and diverse city. The metro is very clean, cheap and efficient but who wants to spend half of each day travelling ? I booked a lastminute.com "Top secret Hotel" listed as near the Plaza de Espana for a very attractive price thinking i could bear almost anything for two nights as long as it was central. When the name and location were revealed I was very pleased, the Hotel Coloso has one of the best downtown locations for exploring by foot in all Madrid. Easy to find and reach, a short walk from either Plaza De Espana or Santo Domingo metro stations the Hotel Coloso looks modern and attractive on first view, its polished granite facings standing out against the old brownstones. Reception is not opulent but is comfortable and welcoming. The night receptionist who greeted my late arrival was charm itself, assigning me room 616 in the attic. I also took advantage of the €10 breakfast offer. Access to the roofspace rooms is quaint, but no hassle with my small travel case. It was a converted attic room, with a velux window.overlooking Madrileno rooftops. Not a panoramic view, but a very interesting one ! The room was somewhat tired in decoration , but well appointed with a splendid bathroom, modern TV and huge queen sized bed. The aircon and heater worked well, but i did not need them during my stay. The room was perfectly warm enough against the winter hill without extra heat. The bed was firm and comfortable, just as I liked it, but the mattress was sagging somewhat. The room faced the street, and being next to a police station meant there was street noise and sirens, but as for me I EXPECT such when I visit an exciting metropolis like Madrid. The double glazed velux window kept 99% of such sound out anyway. The breakfast buffet was plentiful and of good quality. The cafe con leche from the machines there was heavenly, and fresh juices and breads abounded. Staff again were very efficient and friendly. The day staff helped me with maps and information, again highly commended. Downsides ? No bar or restaurant was a pity, but these are easily found in this quarter of Madrid. Also looking back I think that the attic rooms of the sixth floor are reserved for "internet bargain" travellers, as I caught a glimpse of a suite on the 5th floor when it was being serviced and it was a class above in appointments and opulence than mine, but I have no complaints. A lick of paint in the attic rooms is all that is required. All in all the Hotel Coloso added hugely to my weekend in Madrid, and for the price I paid ( €50 per day) for a comfortable and safe city-centre hotel i would recommend it strongly for independent travellers.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: uddina
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in July 2011, the hotel is centrally located, near to a few tube stations and is very clean and comfortable! I'd recommend it for a short stay!

Reviews.Title: “3-star noisy hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: dvtraveler25
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just next to Grand Via, 5 minutes walk to the Royal Palace and very close to the all sights of Madrid, perfect location, but that's the only positive about the hotel. We got a room which was facing to the street, we really could not sleep as it was so noisy during the whole night.We felt that there is not separation between the room and the noise of the street. The room was clean and spacious, but the furnitures are tired and the windows are not soundproofed. The bathroom was clean and spacious. We did not try the breakfast as it seemed too expensive for 15.5€ when there are several great bars in the neighbourhood. In my opinion it is ridiculous that you have to give 20€ deposit for using the safe in the room in a 4 star category... If you are lucky and get a room which is not facing to the street you might not be as disappointed but this hotel is definately not 4 star but 3.

Reviews.Title: “poor quality for a Romantic weekend”
Reviews.Author: LeoB188590
Reviews.Content: We booked a Romantic week, with a double room. The rooms were very small and the bed also. The first night we slept in room 128, that was terible: very small, very noisy and close to the street. After complaining we got another room, but it was very simple

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Stella_VV
Reviews.Content: The location is very good - close to metro stations and within a walking distance from all major attractions. There is a police department next door so it feels really safe :) Rooms are clean and kind of cozy. Staff was friendly and helpful. It is definitely not a 4-star hotel, but I would recomment it anyway.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous2843
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Coloso for 4 nights in September. It is definitely not a 4-star hotel, might have been when it was built but by now it really shows some wear and tear. Our bathroom was tiny and the grouting, because it was so old, looked dirty although it probably was clean. The breakfast was very nice, buffet style and a very good selection. The location was perfect, walking distance to Plaza de Espana metro station as well as Plaza Santo Domingo metro. We took the metro from the airport, line 8 leaving from Terminal 2, change at Nuevos Ministerios, take line 10 to Plaza de Espana, it took us exactly 30 minutes,much faster than taxis in the very busy city of Madrid and considerably cheaper (5 Euros for 2 tickets). We found the beds very hard but that is a very personal consideration. The staff at the reception were very welcoming and nice. The immediate area around the hotel is not nice at all but there is a police station nearby so one feels quite safe.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice rooms, a little too expensive sometimes”
Reviews.Author: Thomas G
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, with nice, big rooms and helpful staff. Free internet and newspapers at the lounge. Wanted to stay one night at end August and anothe one at mid-September, but to my surprise the price in September was twice as much (100) as in August (50), so I stayed in August and looked for a cheaper alternative (Praktik Metropol) for September. Excellent price value for 50-60 euros, but 100 is really too much.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: Nedjmarahal
Reviews.Content: Very good location, good service and that's all.... This is definitely not a 4 stars hotel....I would say a 2 stars. I understand that they are doing renovations to improve the hotel and give it a better shap but I do not understand why should I pay same price for a room with an open roof in the bathroom and suffer the smell of dust!?? The price should consider the unpleasant odors and noise but it was not! I didn't try their breakfest....too expensive (15 euros). You could have a very good one for 5 Euros...a lot of choices in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel Good Location”
Reviews.Author: FlashG
Reviews.Content: We were looking a balance between value and location and this hotel did not dissapoint. A short walk from the Puerta del Sol, the hotel is down a realitvely small road but it is in a perfectly safe location. The hotel is also close to many restuarants and shops. Our room was a very strange shape being in the corner of the hotel, but the bed was large and comfortable. The staff were very friendly and helpful and would reccommend this to anyone who want to explore madrid! Another point is that this hotel is also close to many Metro stations

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: SweetFreesia
Reviews.Content: The good: the staff was very helpful and even opened the very nice breakfast buffet 15 minutes earlier (their idea) to accommodate our early airline flight. Plus they brought extra pillow within 5 minutes. There was a seating area in our spacious room. Unfortunately, the bad, and why I would not return...the shower had substantial amounts of fuzzy-looking black mildew along the grout lines and in the corner (even though otherwise the room and bathroom were clean). The bed was also so hard that I tried to sleep on the couch but as it was too short for me so I ended up back on the bed and got about 3 hours sleep. My husband felt the same way. And, by the way, we are normal sized people and this is even keeping in mind that we found the mattresses in European hotels to be firmer than in the States on our 2-week vacation, but this was much worse.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money - Stay here”
Reviews.Author: happyfeet35
Reviews.Content: I read very conflicting views on this hotel and was very worried that I was going to book a a lemon, but It was a good hotel. The rooms are clean, basic and quiet (we had asked the hotel). We stayed over the weekend and we didnt hear anything. The WIFI was strong (important for me) and the staff was quite helpful. There were some comments about the area around it, but frankly, it was better being here than in Sol with everyone plastered. The location is brilliant with 2 metro stations closeby. Book here

Reviews.Title: “Bright, clean, comfortable and great staff”
Reviews.Author: elvas
Reviews.Content: Excellent situation just off Gran Via and Espana and yards from Plaza Santo Domingo. Rooms comfortable and large with good bathroom. Quiet and unaware of road noise. Mini markets abound along with restaurants, bars, shops sights. The staff were great, friendly, helpful and efficient. Breakfasts good with impressive selection. Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Coloso”
Reviews.Author: manxboy
Reviews.Content: Good location in old Madrid, close to the Metro and Grand Via. Friendly and helpful reception staff, supplies of extra pillow and towels were forthcoming and efficient. The room was a good size and the wooden floors were a bonus during this unusually warm month. Sadly the air con doesn't function at this time of the year, but there was a window that, albeit noisy at times provided some much needed ventilation. The bathroom was very much in need of restoration and attention, especially the mould ingrained in the tiles & sealant around the bath. We chose to breakfast outside the hotel as this was a cheaper and more varied option.

Reviews.Title: “should be a second option”
Reviews.Author: docolla
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is perfect. Just next to the Plaza de Espana and Gran Via, right next to public transportation. The room itself had a musky smell, there was mold in our bathtub, the beds felt like cots and in general the rooms need to be renovated. The noise from the street at night didn't let us sleep. A big plus for the wireless internet access in the room. People at the reception desk are very nice, go an extra mile to satisfy clients and speak english fluently. This is definitely not a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just the job for a city break”
Reviews.Author: raqueluchi
Reviews.Content: perfectly located just off Gran Vía so great if you want to catch a musical. Walking distance to almost everything else. Room was clean, as was bathroom but no view whatsoever (looking into interior patio) but that's not what we went for. Very friendly reception staff. We didn't take breakfast so I can't comment.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & good value”
Reviews.Author: vanmunchen
Reviews.Content: This is more of an average 3 star hotel than a 4 star but perfectly adequate nevertheless - smart with good facilities and at a very reasonable price. Reception service could be better. On arrival I had to wait for someone to appear and later on, someone else waiting at the reception desk asked me if I knew where the staff were! On checking in I was asked if I wanted two single beds or a double bed – which is nice to be given the choice. Room was of a good size with air conditioning, minibar, room safe, desk, flat screen TV (only BBC World and CNN for English language speakers). Bathroom was a good size with bath and shower although the towels could have been of better quality. Rooms at the front of the hotel had balconies but my room was at the back and, although therefore quiet, it had no view other than walls of the sides of the hotel. Unfortunately the room had a musty smell which, although I could open a window, I could not dispel. Breakfast buffet was very good with all kinds of pastries, breads, fruit, cold meats, cheeses etc plus hot items; egg, bacon, sausages etc. A big plus was free internet access available near the reception area. Location is excellent; just a few minutes from Gran Via. Despite the few minor drawbacks as mentioned, I was generally pleased with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a hotel in madrid”
Reviews.Author: samm28
Reviews.Content: When we checked-in we were told that we would be staying at the hotel's new section, which was half a block away. The so called "new section" was another hotel under another name. We were told that if we wanted the breakfast we would have to go to the old section of the hotel, which means we had to walk out of the hotel and walk for half a block and enter the "old section" of the hotel. But there are plenty of places to eat breakfast and also a supermarket (el cort ingles) further down the street. Besides that little issue, the room itself was very nice and clean. Location wise, the hotel is near almost every major sight in madrid, gran via is just a 5 min. walk away. Also, there is a subway station (plaza espana) near the hotel, and as well as many shops and restaurants. The only down side to the location is that the street the hotel is on, gets very noisy at night since there were many night clubs on that street. But all in all the hotel is great and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel. Good location. Nicely priced.”
Reviews.Author: Naim00
Reviews.Content: A very decent hotel in a good location few steps away from Puerta del Sol and all other attractions. The street of the hotel itself is not impressive at all. Another narrow, one way city street with a couple of chinese stores around. There is NO view from the rooms whatsoever. Talking about rooms, they are large, but a waste of space. We had 2 rooms and both had a small living room attached to them. The beds are tiny but clean and bathrooms are very decent. They have a parking in the basement and charge around 16euros a night (otherwise good luck finding a spot to park in Madrid). Overall a good place in Madrid for a decent price. No major negatives, except the fact that they leave one set of towels per BR and we had to ask for more. They were very pleasant and helpful. FREE INTERNET and works well in the rooms. Breakfast buffet looked cheap even though it costs 12 or 15 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Californiatravelor
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week in Madrid at the Hotel El Coloso. We had a non-smoking room in the back off the street so it was very quiet. The staff were friendly and helpful. The bed was horrible, like sleeping on a board. I was also disappointed that I couldn’t get complimentary coffee. However the hotel is well situated for walking around Madrid. A metro stop is at either end of the block, making it convenient for getting around.

Reviews.Title: “A fine hotel at a reasonable rate”
Reviews.Author: swifticus
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here after reading these very reviews and are glad we did. The hotel is located in what can only be described as Madrid's "Chinatown", but with a police station just two doors down, we never felt unsafe. Beyond that one block, however, is the Gran Via (celebrating it's 100th anniversary this year) and it's many shops and theaters. Two Metro stops are just a block away in either direction and the famed Plaza Mayor is just a metro stop away. We didn't need anything from the front desk, so I can't really speak to their service, but the gentleman who assigned us the room was friendly enough, even though his English was a little weak. After reading some reviews we requested a room away from the street. We were warned that there's no view from that side of the hotel, but the only view you get is of the building across the street, so it wasn't much of a lose. So, since we were away from the street, we slept quite well each night. I'm not sure if there were people in the adjacent room. Sometimes I'd hear people shuffling around as though the walls were made of paper, other times I heard nothing at all, but, again, no street noise from our back room on the first floor. The room itself was small, but it suited us just fine. The shower had hot water and there was a bedet (which I have yet to use). A word of warning, the only station on the TV that plays anything in english is German MTV and a 24 hour news channel, also, Hulu and Netflix watch instantly don't work outside the U.S. So, if you're looking to relax for a couple of hours before going out again, bring a book or music or something...or you can always watch South Park in German (or the Jersey Shore - which is surprisingly popular in Germany)...oh speaking of internet...there's free wifi and our signal was crystal clear. So, yes, I would recommend this hotel to anyone who gets that being in Madrid is about walking around, eating food, and using the hotel room to sleep and shower. It's close, convenient, safe, and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service good, rooms smokey”
Reviews.Author: GandA10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days, very central location - right next to Gran Via, easy walk to El Prado, La Puerta Alcala, Palacio Real, Opera. The price was good as we got a cheap deal through easyjet.com. However, our room smelt of smoke (cigarettes) but the staff were really helpful and moved us when asked.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value, rooms clean but small”
Reviews.Author: Ja423
Reviews.Content: Staying at Plaza Espana is great way to explore Madrid specially if you are short on time, and this hotel has a great location - close to the metro station. The hotel staff were very helpful and spoke perfect English. The room we got was tight for 2 people though very clean and adequate. If you plan on spending most of your day exploring the city and just coming back to sleep here, this place is ideal. Our room faced the inside of the building so there was really NO view. But that was okay with us as it provided good value for the money. One tip - very close to this hotel is Oskar cafe which is a great authentic cafe that opens early for breakfast. A great place to eat there and get your day started.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - 5 minutes walk from Royal Palace.”
Reviews.Author: KimBlythe
Reviews.Content: Hotel El Coloso was rated as a 4 star but for this I would expect to find something along the lines of free bottled water or at least a kettle in the room. Sadly these were missing but apart from this it scrubbed up very nicely. Sara at reception (as mentioned in another review) spoke excellent English so deal with her if at all possible. The rest of the staff's English was not quite as good as it could be, to the extent that, when we called down to reception to ask how to use the safe (for this you need to put a 20 euro deposit down for the key), someone answered the phone then left me hanging to find someone who spoke English to answer my query. He left me waiting for so long that i just hung up. When we checked in the man on the desk was more concerned with answering the phone than dealing with us in person so we waited for around 10 minutes before even being acknowledged. Having said all that, their English is still better than my Spanish. We did not have breakfast here as it seemed too expensive though the restaurant looked very nice. Plenty of cafes nearby where you can grab a quick coffee and a pastry. The hotel is located on a very busy side street which had roadworks outside during our stay so if we weren't kept awake by revellers on their way home, we were awakened by the drilling which started at 8.30. Having said all that though, we did know this before we booked so were aware of what we were letting ourselves in for. The plus side of the location was therefore its proximity to the city's sights. A 2 minute walk from Santo Domingo metro station but equally within 5/10 minutes walk of the Royal Palace at Plaza Oriente, (free on Wednesdays) 10/15 minutes from the cathedral and within 20 minutes of Plaza Mayor and Puerta de Sol. So really near to everything you need to visit (worth getting the metro to Retiro Park though). The bullring museum was 9 stops away at Ventas. We would also recommend getting a coach out to visit the city of Toledo (less than an hour on the direct coach from Plaza Eliptica), a beautiful medieval walled city with a host of more free exhibitions. We would recommend the direct coach though not the stopping one as this seemed to take forever on the way out. Also worth a visit was the Prado art exhibition in Madrid (around a 15/20 minute walk), free after 6pm, and in fact to be honest there wasn't much that we actually did pay for! Food was fairly inexpensive if you looked for the good deals, so in general a fantastic trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Gateslady
Reviews.Content: This hotel is near two metro stations (Plaza Espana and San Domingo) set back from the Gran Via (so little traffic noise) and easy walking distance to Puerta del Sol and Palacio Real. The location is ideal as a base from which to explore Madrid. Hotel staff were helpful and friendly. Breakfast was expensive but there was a choice of bars and restaurants close by all serving good breakfast at reasonable cost. We were offered a front facing room with a balcony but were warned that we may be disturbed by construction work going on just outside the hotel entrance so we chose a room at the back of the hotel with absolutely no view and transluscent windows where we had peaceful nights! Our room was modern and comfortable not that we spent much time in it! We would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Definately NOT a 4 star hotel, some staff nice, others abnoxious”
Reviews.Author: CLR2009
Reviews.Content: We had reservations which included the breakfast buffet, they tried to deny it at checkout. We requested a no smoking floor, which they gave us - then with the air conditioning on during the night the smoke started to waft in very heavily. I could not sleep until I turned off the air conditioning and opened a window. The next morning I complained and they said why didn't you call last night - I DID CALL THE RECEPTION BUT NO ONE PICKED UP AT 2:30 am. They could not accommodate our SUV in the parking lot so we had to hoof it now hill to Plaza Espana and park it in the public parking. Now how many hotels do you know that consider themselves to be 4 stars, don't have parking for luxury cars, no elevator on the ground floor and have air intake for the AC by a club exhaust.

Reviews.Title: “Should be avoided as 1st (or 2nd) option”
Reviews.Author: rooskie007
Reviews.Content: Not very good English language skills by staff that's working in El Coloso, some of them ignoring objections on WIFI not working - 4 star hotel that has no Internet connection in the rooms, with WIFI no working and only two computers that you have to fight over with bunch of US soccer kids, nor any pool or gym to relax in definitely doesn't deserve it's stars. Or at least some of them. On the contrary, breakfast is great, staying there for a week didn't make me feel like I'm getting bored with choices they offer. Probably the best orange juice I've ever tried. Location itself is great, although, you should avoid street facing room because there's a police station with patrol cars running around day and night. Inner viewing rooms are facing horrible pipe-view, but it's quiet, at least. As somebody already stated, you could find simmilar location for equal money with better offer.

Reviews.Title: “stinks - in more ways than one”
Reviews.Author: braziac
Reviews.Content: stayed here just for the one night - there are much better hotels in madrid in roughly the same area, for the same price. took about 20 minutes to check in due to some sort of confusion (no idea what) and when we entered our room we were hit with the most ungodly stink which i can only assume was coming from the drains in the bathroom (the stink remained however fortunately we spent very little time in there). generally, room was a bit grubby, staff couldn't care less, and although it's not the worst hotel i've stayed in, there really isn't a single reason to return there.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid it”
Reviews.Author: MichaelVisits
Reviews.Content: I was only booked in for one night and this was one too many. The a/c in the room only made a noise but do not perform any other function so I did not get any sleep. The bed was very firm, not too bad for me, but other peole I was travelling with did not like thier beds at all. The shower did not work properly as the head just leaked most of the water instead of spraying it. I will not be staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: rene_555
Reviews.Content: hotel is very easy to find via public transport. from the airport take the tube. the tube nearest to the hotel (plaza espagna. please mind my spelling!) is on the same line as the airport, and will cost you less than a couple of euros to get there. saves heaps on taxi costs! the hotel itself is nice. free internet in lobby (although only one pc so not always available) and free refreshments like lemon and orange water are placed on the reception desk throughout the day. room was okay. no view from window, but to be expected in a city i guess. quite dim due to little natural light, so lights always needed to be on when in the room. very clean and spacious. bathroom gorgeous marble. again, very clean. cleaners were great. ensure air-con and lights are on for your arrival home. all linen is clean and fresh. didn't eat in the resturant but looks very, very nice indeed. im just a very fussy eater, which is a shame becasue the menu was quite substantial for my partner. location is great with the metro so close. only warning i should probably give are there are a couple of... well. gentlemans clubs along the road. not noisy though and only really noticed on the last night when coming home at about 3am. not rowdy. just an escort waiting on the door to welcome men in at that time. not a busy steeet of activity however, so i still think it is perfectly okay for familes. infact the police station is pretty much next door to the hotel and there is always a couple of officers standing guard. another security thing that might be nice for families to know if staying. overall a very good hotel. quality assured. good air con and clean rooms. not much more you can ask for!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: freyagirl
Reviews.Content: Hotel El Coloso is located on a little side street off the Grand Via in Madrid - between two main Metro stops and squares. There are dozens of nice restaurants nearby and a police precinct just a couple doors down from the hotel. My husband and I spent 4 nights there in May while we toured Madrid. The building is old and the streets are very narrow in this area. The neighborhood is really charming and old, but the hotel has very modern facilities. The room was not huge, but nice and clean with a really great bathroom all done in marble. The bed was only a double (we should have taken the offer for two beds) and very very firm. the room looked into an air shaft so no view, but the price was very good for such a central location. The lobby is nice and has free access to the internet via a laptop. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful on finding places to go and things to do. There are stairs to the lobby and also to the elevators, so this is NOT a friendly place for someone with mobility issues. The breakfast buffet is pricey but good and the buffet room has a great view of the street. Otherwise there is a Starbucks just a block away as well as several small diners. I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A safe bet. Very handy for main shops and walking to main attractions”
Reviews.Author: CPFCeagles
Reviews.Content: Bit apprehensive as read mixed reviews. Pretty good location 5 mins from main shopping area on Gran Via. Not exactly the finest location in Madrid but ok and safe in indo chinese area- Excellent staff and breakfast. Had two adjacent rooms- double was really small but the twin was excellent. Clean/ wifi accessed free . Lovely and quiet at night and no noise from other guests. Excellent choice of metro but mind your choice of exit so dont walk too far ! Art galleries, Royal Palace, Cable Car all walkable- metro to both football stadia and theme park (s)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great service”
Reviews.Author: Rosani
Reviews.Content: I went to Madrid to visit a few girlfriends (who live all over Europe) and after much searching we settled on this hotel as it appeared to have great location and was a good price. We were not disappointed - it is located on a side street but it isn't bad, next to the Police station but I never heard a noise (and we were there over a weekend) and very easy to find. The hotel itself is very modern and comfortable, with good sized rooms and very friendly front desk staff. There is an Internet PC available for use and it is very handy to check email, reconfirm flights, etc. The only thing we didn't like was the breakfast as it was far too expensive but we were not far from Vips where we had a really great value breakfast with good coffee. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Typical European City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JFair
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 days in November. The hotel was fine overall, while I have no complaints I also don't have anything spectacular to say about it. The lobby was nice enough, free computer to use. The location was decent for the price, not right near the attractions but only 5 minutes from the Gran Via. The street itself was a bit sketchy, but I didn't have any problems as a single female. The room was 3 star quality, with a nice bathroom, TV worked well, but nothing special, lots of closet space. Hotel staff was fine, nothing of note. Overall for $130/night it was not bad at all. Typical European hotel in the city, for the price in Madrid not bad at all. I'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “An OK hotel, not outstanding but no real problems”
Reviews.Author: David92263
Reviews.Content: The first and important tip about Hotel El Caloso, Calle de Leganitos 13, Madrid would be to ignore the map which says it is just by Plaza de Espana, Arrive in central Madrid by Metro from t.he airport at Barajas by all means; it’s €2 as opposed to over €30 by taxi – a huge saving unless you travel in the crowded rush period when the Metro is chaotic. BUT when you alight at P de Espana there are several flights of stairs to negotiate followed by a significant climb up Calle de Leganitos, and if you are schlepping bags on a warm evening it will kill you. I booked on Expedia and the hotel lobby meets the pictures on that site. The hotel seems to be composed of an older and a newer section. Two quite separate elevator systems serve those and the old back part has tortuous steps to negotiate before getting to the old, albeit always working elevators. The room was fairly spacious and everything in the en-suite shower room/ half-bath worked well. WiFi was promised and inquiry at the desk indicated that it only works in the lobby. Wrong! It worked in my room and I wish I had established that before I had been there for three nights. The lobby staff is pleasant and helpful but some have a poor command of English. Fair enough – few British hotel staff are fluent in Spanish but that’s generally because they are all Lithuanian. El Coloso is just a few minutes (uphill) walk from P Santa Domingo and a lot of good restaurants, or 5 mins from Gran Via. There's a shuttle bus to the airport for €20. Recommended - sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience.”
Reviews.Author: gliondarcroi
Reviews.Content: Just back from a wonderful weekend in Madrid. This hotel is a stone's throw from the metro station and within walking distance of many of the city's attractions. We were stunned at how many we stumbled upon when we went out for strolls! The staff were very friendly in this hotel, we booked a room and were given a suite at no extra cost. The bed was huge and the room had a large HD tv. The street the hotel is on looks bad but don't let put you off. Getting to and from the airport took us 35 minutes and that included 1 change of line. For that alone it's worth a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: FrequentHolidayer83
Reviews.Content: Whenever I read negative reviews about a hotel, I always presume it's someone who likes complaining, or just had a very unluckly experience. However, I cannot stress strongly enough how bad this hotel is! And all 5 friends I holidayed with agree. The first problem was the location, which is quite a walk from the main attractions. It is based in an extremely dodgy looking area, next to the police station (conveniently) and in an area full of adult bars. The impressive entrance hall is completely ruined by the smell of sewage which greets you on arrival. They couldn't give us rooms on the same floor, despite booking months in advance, and even gave a couple of us a smoking room, which to non-smokers smelt vile. Another room was on the top floor with feeble air conditioning, and the best room filled with the stench of sewage when the air conditioning was left on. To make matters worse, one friend had 80euros stolen from her room, despite hiding it in her luggage. The staff were rude and unhelpful when we reported this and tried to brand us as liars rather than apologising. We later realised they have no security whatsoever. If you want a room key, you tell them which room number and they give you one, no questions asked! This is definitely not a 4 star, or even 3 star hotel. You have been warned!

Reviews.Title: “Large room, nice lobby”
Reviews.Author: Bikers_Mom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Coloso our last night in Spain. The location is a little seedy but there is a police station just down the block. The hotel room was quite large but the bathroom was small (both were clean and serviceable). Access to the airport via the Metro is easy from this hotel. Breakfast was tasty though not included.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but at bit torn down”
Reviews.Author: Tubaturid
Reviews.Content: Easy access through the METRO. Walking distance to large parts of the city. We got a room with AC making a lot of noise but got another room within 15 minutes. The other room had a clean but old bathroom. Over all, satisfied, but renovating would'nt be a bad idea...

Reviews.Title: “Great suites...”
Reviews.Author: Pagazaurtundua
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend and the suite was really amazing. It's sort of an old hotel but it has been revamped and it's really nice now. Very clode to Plaza de España and the Gran Vía. Good hotel for a weekend even if on a not so nice street.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Travelista77
Reviews.Content: We took a break from our vacation in Malaga and decided to hop a plane to Madrid. We stayed at the Hotel El Coloso from the 7-9 of June 2007 and was pleasantly surprised. I had never stayed at a hotel in Europe (always stayed with friends/family) and frankly, was afraid after reading reviews. I know that four star hotels in the US are luxury whereas in Europe are bare bones. I expected a dank, small room in a crumbling hotel with rude staff. I was pleasantly surprised when we arrived at 8:30AM and the staff allowed us to check in immediately (check in is sometime between 10AM - 12PM) We booked a double but received a gigantic room that slept 4. I won't bore you with the rest but will break it down into pros and cons. Pros: • Rooms. Clean, large, with dark wood floors, large closets and marble bathrooms with shower/tub combos and bidet. • 1 block over from the Gran Via and one block up from the Plaza Espana. Easy walk to shops, park and sightseeing. • Relatively friendly staff, free internet in the lobby, relatively large rooms compared to American standards • Next door to a police station • Great for couples or singles (read on to the cons to learn why) Cons: • 1 block up from several topless bars - though I must say we never saw anything untoward and they were relatively low key. • Air Conditioning. We moved from one room to another ( which was across from the elevator banks) because the AC didn't work. In the second room it did, but was weak. The staff were amenable and moved us immediately when we requested the move at 12AM. • Views. But then again, you're not living there, right? It didn't bother us because we went out to see the city every day and the view of the alley really didn't matter when we got back - we were so exhausted from moving and shaking that we were asleep before our heads hit the pillow. Other • On a small side street. I don't really count this as a con because it's Europe and everything is on a small side street. But if you are driving, know that there are cars parked on both sides of the street and maneuvering into the garage is not easy. I think the garage is also separate from the hotel and costs per day. • No peephole or chain on room doors. There is a safe and a regular deadbolt. Make sure you do lock your door and you'll be OK (kinda common sense, right? And they are NEXT DOOR to a police station) But housekeeping did try to enter when we first got in and I forgot to deadbolt our door. • Communication. I spoke much more Spanish than my boyfriend and was often the translator. The front desk speaks OK English but will always start (and possibly) in Spanish, even if they know you don't speak it. Housekeeping knows little English. Carry a pocket translator and you'll be fine - we worked it out, so can you! Overall, great stay at a small hotel. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “No A/C in 4 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WS57
Reviews.Content: Hotel El Coloso in Madrid - Just got back from Madrid & stayed at this hotel 5/17 & 18. NO A/C! We were told by one staff person that it was to be turned on next week; another staff person said they had been working on it but it was still broken. Had a room on the 4th floor which is noisy enough w/the street noise but to open the windows to get hot air in was even more noise. Police station is a few doors down which I guess is good (if you need them) but noise all night long from that. The bedspreads on the beds, throw pillows & curtains were dingy & soiled. The room needed painting. The hallway was dark & dingy, needed painting. If you can't do steps, this hotel is not for you, you have to walk up quite a few steps to the reception & to get the rooms on the side of the hotel we were on, even more steps. The hall ways smelled bad too. The staff was very nice & helpful. If you are staying here in the next week or so I would call & ask if the A/C works.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be put off by previous reviews!!!”
Reviews.Author: maddiePortsmouth
Reviews.Content: Based on previous reviews we were dreading this hotel which we'd been given as part of a citybreak present so couldn't change it but we needn't have worried.Hotel was clean,smart and our room didn't smell of sewage at all-in fact none of the hotel smelled bad. Location was great and staff were really friendly. Breakfast was great too - smoked salmon,the lot. Please give this hotel a chance - it's well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Awful. Truly awful”
Reviews.Author: AOkoro
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here in Feb 2007 thanks to a friend who refused my suggestion to use Tripadvisor before making the booking. Not an experience I´d care to repeat in a hurry. First room I was allocated was an attic room with a sloping roof, meaning I had to crouch to get around. The view from the window? A wall 15 ft away. On complaining, it was changed - to one with a truly revolting smell of blocked sewage (as I think another reviewer also found). Two complaints later, nothing was done so I had to spend the first night there. I was finally moved to a THIRD room the following day - which also smelt of sewage. Oh, and the hotel is 30yds from a huge building site. PS: Did I mention the rooms reek of sewage? AVOID, AVOID, AVOID.

Reviews.Title: “hotel coloso”
Reviews.Author: mzip
Reviews.Content: Ok we bought the 3 nights we stayed at a travel agency in Benidorm with a thing called bancohotel that gives you hotels of 3 or 4 stars at affordable prices. We took this one based on location, wich was perfect its very near Gran Via, Callao etc. and has metro access just a walk away. I would say about this hotel the staff is friendly, its very clean, but location is the most important thing. We had a double room in the newer part of the hotel and it was fine for what we paid for, Yes its not the ritz or a high class hotel but in Madrid hotels are very expensive so I think you cant expect a luxury hotel in a very centric area for about 90 dolars. So yes its a bit smelly, they do have air conditioning/heat, the rooms are big by european standards, and very clean, the bathrooms OK no big deal there, the elevators yes a bit old and the hallways a bit narrow but all in all I liked my stay in the coloso and would go back again. They even held our luggage for us like for 10 hours no problem. I think after reading most of the reviews here I wouldnt have given it a chance, but my stay there was very comfortable and nice. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “what a pong”
Reviews.Author: HisFussiness
Reviews.Content: I chose the hotel on the basis of price and location. And yes it is in a good central location. But there is no excuse for a vile stench of raw sewage in a hotel room. The reception staff did react efficiently once I mentioned the smell (sounds like they're used to it) and offered me another room. This one overlooked the street, and although a narrow oneway side-street, there was one long procession of traffic all night long. Whether traffic was being diverted from Gran Via or not on the 2 nights I was there I do not know, but I didn't get much sleep. Sorry El Coloso - but I would have to give you a miss next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: The_Explorers
Reviews.Content: We like others were a little apprehensive about booking the hotel after reading some of the reviews, but knowing the location from previous visits to Madrid decided to 'take a chance'. I must say we were very surprised with the outcome, and we had a very enjoyable 2 nights stay. The hotel itself is tucked away down a side street, as most are in this historic part of madrid, but this gave the hotel a good peaceful quiet location. The welcome we received, quality of reception, and the quality of the room were above average. The room (4th floor, back) was large, modern and clean, with almost silent air conditioning. Buffet breakfast was good and priced at just under £10 so average for a 4* hotel. Location is excellent with just a short stroll to theatres, art galleries, shops, monuments etc. The only downside was that we booked an airport taxi to come home and this was overpriced by about 10 Euro's so our advice is to flag one down outside the hotel and save the money. Otherwise a very enjoyable stay in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Kwalchavad
Reviews.Content: Due to the different reviews I read about this hotel I was a bit worried. Fortunately my worries died quickly. The staff was very friendly from the first minute. The room was huge, and in great condition. We stayed in the ground floor and that as well was a bonus as the room was 30 seconds away from the street. All in all it was luxury for an unbeliavable low price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: SLF&JLF
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in was very small. Amazingly, it had a double bed not like most European hotels that push 2 singles together. The bathroom was very small. The location was great. Just off the Gran Via and a short walk for Sol. It is in the old part of the city, so it is very difficult to access by car. The street the hotel is on is very narrow. They do offer car parking though for a small fee.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great price.”
Reviews.Author: FmhR4ad
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nice, clean and very affordable. After reading some of the previous reviews, my wife and I were a little nervous about staying here but we didn't experience any of the bad aspects described by other users. The only bad point was probably the noise from other people arriving to their rooms in the middle of the night, but personally I don't think it was such a big deal. It can happen in any Hotel, especially in Madrid :) Others complain about no A/C in the rooms, I don't have a say about it as it wasn't that hot and didn't have the need of using it. I prefer opening the windows anyway. Rooms are huge for European standards. Location is also good; sightseeing, shopping, restaurants, etc. are all within walking distance. The hotel is very close to two metro stations, served by three different lines so you can practically get anywhere. To and from the airport is only one transfer in the metro. Breakfast at the hotel is very good but a little bit pricey, however there are many options in the area. Staff is helpful, all in all a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel El Coloso - Good Value for your $$”
Reviews.Author: RickStevesJr
Reviews.Content: We stayed in El Coloso 1 night in early Feb 2006 prior to returning back to US. Price was right 75 Euros including IVA. Hotel staff was very helpful. Hotel is located next to a police station. Double pane windows kept most noise out. Location is great. 1 min walk to Metro, 5 min walk to Palacio Real, 10 min walk to Puerta del Sol and Plaza Mayor. Hallways were a bit stuffy, but room was clean. I hear some rooms have problems with odor from sewer lines; something common throughout Spain. Ours did not, I guess we were lucky. Overall, this hotel provided a good night sleep in a great location prior to the long flight back home at an affordable price (compared to rest of Madrid). Would recommend to family and friends. Hotel website : --------- (pics are accurate) Booked through quehoteles Also visited Sevilla and Toledo

Reviews.Title: “posh nosh......”
Reviews.Author: fritzy
Reviews.Content: short & sweet, this hotel is very good in every aspect, very clean, welcoming & friendly. Breakfast is a must very filling for all the walking you will be doing!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Thought it wasn't bad until the Bed Bugs!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just visited Madrid with another couple for three days. We found it to be a pretty good location, not far from a Metro stop and a walk to the Grand Via. On this block of the street there is major construction work being done on two other buildings, so you have to walk under scaffolding and avoid debris and dust and the annoyance of construction noise, not a great first impression. Our first impression of the hotel walking down the hallway to our rooms was a musty old smell. Bathrooms were clean, not bad. Rooms are a good size. Beds are rock hard, took getting used to. They also left us bathrobes and slippers. In the morning, my girlfriend took a shower and was going to use the bathrobe and noticed several bugs crawling on them, we threw them out of the room and into the laundry cart. We figured the place is old and where they store the robes may have a few bugs. That night our skin was itching, we blamed it on the weather, it was quite cold in Madrid that week. The other couple confirmed the same itchy feeling at night. The last night of our stay, my girlfriend woke in the middle of the night itching, turned on the lights right away and there they were, bed bugs!! The mattress was infested, we lifted it and saw more underneath, some were even in the pillow. We were disgusted and couldn't wait to leave for our next destination. We found front desk to be indifferent, snooty and even dishonest when they tried to falsly charge us for items from the minibar. I would never stay here again and cannot recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Charming oasis”
Reviews.Author: JHG22
Reviews.Content: This clean hotel was like an oasis in the middle of a busy city! It was on a little street that wasn't great but the hotel was lovely. The staff were friendly and helpful with all our enquiries.

Reviews.Title: “All in all, not too bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although there are certainly much nicer hotels to stay at while in Madrid, El Coloso is a fairly good hotel for the money (approximately $90 U.S. when we stayed there during Feb. 05). It is centrally located and within walking distance of all the major attractions and restaurants. Our room was very nice and clean. My only complaint was of a sewage type odor that went away when you opened the windows. Although it was winter, it was very pleasant to sleep with the windows partially open. The staff was also very courteous. I agree with the other reviewers that the street that the hotel is on looks questionable, but in reality it is fine. It also has the advantage of a police station nearby. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Given the mixed reviews of this hotel given by other users on this site, I was a little leery of staying here after I booked a flight and hotel on Expedia for our honeymoon. However, it was a good deal and seemed to be in a good location, so my new wife and I decided to give it a try. Overall, most of the reviews are accurate, although people seem to focus on the good or bad aspects only, when it in fact has many good and bad points. Our room was in the "older" section of the hotel (it occupies two buildings, only connected by one hallway), which looks a little run-down in the hallways and has very small and somewhat rickety elevators. The rooms are quite nice, however, and in decent shape. Our original room was on the 5th floor up on the back side, and we could hear some very loud construction noises during the daytime. Worse, the air conditioning fan did not work, so it became very warm. I complained to the front desk, who set up a maintenace person to look at it, but they could not fix it. We slept there one night and complained again the next day as the inside temperature was above 80 F, at which point we were moved to a 4th floor room on the front (street) side, which was bigger (especially the bathroom) and had functional A/C. From that point on, the stay was fine save for some minor annoyances, such as the room featuring two twin beds rather than a king-size, which seems to be common among European hotels. This hotel is on a dubious-looking street, but we did not experience and incidence of theft or other problems. It is convienent to the metro stations (two of them) as well as many of the historic sights such as the Palacio Real. Overall, it was a good place to stay for the money (about $75 US a night) and served us well. If you want better quality, you should be prepared to spend more money (like in the $100 - $150 range), but for the price, this place is pretty decent - just make sure you get a good room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, good vfm.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: El Coloso was fine for our purposes. We stayed for three nights on a sightseeing and nightlife trip. The room was clean, well equipped and great value for money with separate tv/lounge area and very quiet and efficient aircon. We had no view - but to be honest I don't think it really mattered, you don't go to Madrid to sit in your room and stare out of the window! The reception area was well presented and the staff were all very courteous and helpful. On the downside, the corridors could definitely do with a bit of TLC and the part of the hotel containing our room seemed to be tucked away with cramped, old fashioned, but none-the-less safe, lifts (English for elevators) The immediate area was a tad seedy (or fine if you want lap dancing clubs at 4am, depending on your preference!) but within 5 mins walk in either direction of 2 of the stops for the excellent Madrid metro system and just off the Gran Via. Other reviews have said they had difficulty finding the street - but to be honest we didn't find it that much of a challenge with a half decent map. Overall I would stay here again, it's a good base from which to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the El Coloso even though it was hard to find”
Reviews.Author: puzzlelover
Reviews.Content: Even though it was so conveniently located just up the street from Plaza d'Espania and the Plaza Callao, we had a terrible time the first morning. It's a lovely hotel with a recently renovated lobby and check in area. I think part of the hote rooms has also been done over, but we were in an older room. Plain and largely undecorated, it was immaculate and simply the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in Europe. Our room was in a courtyard which kept it quiet but also hard to tell the weather. Staff was most professional. Our breakfast was not included in the rate. On a few mornings, we enjoyed the convenience of eating there although it is oveerpriced. There are other choices conveniently nearby as is a good deal of shopping and restaurants for dinner in all price ranges. If you like Starbvucks, it's just a few blocks away. Another poster had noted the nearby police station and how convenient it was to report the theft of his wallet. I remember laughing at it while we stood waiting to report the theft of ours. We had a wonderful time in Madrid but we had the feeling that there were people waitng to bungee jump off of buildings to grab purses and wallets. It is a disgrace - no sedurity in eveidence at the entrances to tourist atrtractions. We felt like sitting ducks. But I digress. The hotel was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms smell of toilets and NO airconditioning”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Bad service, smelly rooms and no a/c. Couldnt sleep for 2 nights so we had to pay for another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean. OK. Well located for metro”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well furnished rooms, clean wooden floor, tiny but clean bathroom. A little unhappy with our room on the top floor which was very hot even in February, broken air conditioning and naturally noisy when windows open. Didn't feel "luxurious" four stars but we got a good deal and it was fair value. Staff friendly, multilingual, happily look after bags for late flights, arranged late check out for us, generally relaxed. From the airport, most direct route is to get off at Plaza de Espana and walk up Leganitos, it's a little street near Starbucks and some Mexican chain restaurant. Otherwise, to get around, nearest metro is Santo Domingo on red route but a walk to Callao gets you also to the yellow route in less time than it takes to change metros. (---) Didn't try breakfast as there are loads of places nearby, just stretch your legs a little.

Reviews.Title: “great all rounder”
Reviews.Author: dd123Uk
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff, room lovely, great location I would easily reccomend the El coloso. Maybe not a true 4 star in every sense of the word, but I was not dissapointed in any way. Enjoy tour trip!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean and spacious rooms, although neighbor noise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location is not too far from the Palacio Real, which makes it a great little walk after sitting at a cafe near the Palacio. The street at first looked questionable but it is very safe and the police station is located only a few doors down. The room was very spacious, as was the bathroom. I had a fifth floor room with a balcony and found the room to be clean and probably a bit of a bargain compared to what I heard some people paid to stay in a 2 star (€94), I paid €101 excl. breakfast for a 4 star. The only complaint was that it was an adjoining room and the ceiling vent had nothing in between, so I could hear the converstations next door rather clearly (although I do not understand much spanish). I think that they did realize it too, as I only had to turn my tv up loud for a minute and they would become quieter. That is the only real complaint which I think management should fix. This is most likely only an issue in adjoining rooms. I would consider staying here again if I came back to Madrid. Oh and I also enjoyed the complete separation of smoking and non-smoking sections in the dining room ( at least 10 meters between the two).

Reviews.Title: “On our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The small staff at El Coloso were very nice. The room was very clean and of a nice size, but the bathroom a bit small. We walked everywhere from the hotel, not having to take a taxi anywhere in Madrid during the time we spent here. We got stuck in the elevator our first night, we had too much baggage with us! Watch out for that. If I returned to Madrid, I would look for another hotel - there were many others in the midst of busier districts that were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: cecille
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 days at El Coloso Madrid from September 11 to September 16. The hotel is nice and clean. The personnel is very kind and the location is great. The only thing I would suggest you is to bring your own Kleenex (there is no tissue paper in the bathroom) and your own hair dryer, the one in the bathroom doesn't work well. The outlets are different than the U.S. ones but you only have to ask the recepcionist for a converter and they will give you one. We reccommend El Coloso and would like to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located just few min away from most attractions in Madrid. Very close to transportation, shops and restaurants. The staff is very responsive and the breakfast buffet is excellent. It is also in a very safe area and just half a block away from a police station. We are giving it only three stars overall for the following reasons: 1) this hotel needs painting, new carpets in the hall more amenities to be classified as a 4 star hotel. The paint in our room and in the hall was chipping off in some areas, the carpets looked ancient and smelled dusty. However, we spent only few short hours in the hotel at night and it didn't bother us much. If you are going to Madrid you'll spend most of the time running around the city. We highly recommend booking a tour to Toledo and Avila/Segovia. Agood travel agent is Julia's Travel on Gran Via or Pullmantour right next to Royal Opera. We also recommend buying a two day ticket for the Madrid Vision bus, it gives you a great overview of the city and has more than one route. if you are planning to see bullfight, find out in advance when they have shows... tickets sell out pretty fast. if you are into the arts we recommend CASA Patas for Flamenco show. Admission is 25 euro and includes 1 drink. Enjoy your trip.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel El Coloso
HotelInfo.Address: Leganitos 13-, 28013 Madrid, Spain
